content: <metadata><idinfo><citation><citeinfo><origin>Chris Krier, Bob Harmon - Idaho Department of Water Resources</origin><pubdate>199292</pubdate><pubtime /><title>Administrative Basins 01-03</title><edition>1</edition><geoform Sync="TRUE">vector digital data</geoform><serinfo><sername /><issue /></serinfo><pubinfo><pubplace>Boise, Idaho</pubplace><publish>IDWR</publish></pubinfo><othercit /><onlink><http://www.idwr.state.id.us/idwr></onlink><ftname Sync="TRUE">adminbasin01-03</ftname></citeinfo></citation><descript><abstract>Idaho Department of Water Resources administrative basin boundaries - basin 01-03. Shapefile should be used as a guide since basins 01-03 are defined as diversions from the snake river along specific reaches.  Basin 01 are diversions from the Snake River (Eastern Idaho Border) to Milner Dam.  Basin 02 is from Milner Dam to the Oregon border. Basin 03 is from where the Snake River reenters the State from Oregon up to Lewiston.</abstract><purpose>To denote the IDWR admin basins for any variety of IDWR programs.</purpose><supplinf> Procedures_Used: 1. Initial linework copied from 100K hydrologic units coverage (see HUCS cover). 2. Where basin boundaries did not conform to HUCS coverage, linework compiled on USGS 1:100,000 quad series maps from 24K and 62.5K USGS quad maps that the IDWR Water Allocation Bureau staff had used to delineate the IDWR basin boundaries on. Boundaries digitized from the 100K maps in pcARC/INFO 3.4 Arcedit. 3. Basin numbers checked against an IDWR 1M map. Revisions: refinement of 21/31 basin boundary done </supplinf><langdata Sync="TRUE">en</langdata></descript><native Sync="TRUE">Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.0 (Build 2195) Service Pack 4; ESRI ArcCatalog 8.3.0.800</native><timeperd><current>ground condition</current><timeinfo><sngdate><caldate>19990101</caldate></sngdate></timeinfo></timeperd><status><progress>Complete</progress><update>Irregular</update></status><spdom><bounding><westbc Sync="TRUE">-117.361428</westbc><eastbc Sync="TRUE">-110.864701</eastbc><northbc Sync="TRUE">46.466214</northbc><southbc Sync="TRUE">42.452047</southbc></bounding><lboundng><leftbc Sync="TRUE">2241685.228867</leftbc><rightbc Sync="TRUE">2740910.040574</rightbc><bottombc Sync="TRUE">1254974.278009</bottombc><topbc Sync="TRUE">1696072.942283</topbc></lboundng></spdom><keywords><theme><themekt>ESRI Geography Network Thesaurus</themekt><themekey>boundaries</themekey></theme><place><placekt>None</placekt><placekey>Idaho</placekey></place></keywords><accconst>Public</accconst><useconst>Shapefile should be used as a guide since basins 01-03 are defined as diversions from the snake river along specific reaches.</useconst><natvform Sync="TRUE">Shapefile</natvform><ptcontac><cntinfo><cntorgp><cntorg>Idaho Department of Water Resources</cntorg><cntper>Michael Ciscell</cntper></cntorgp><cntpos>GIS Analyst, Senior</cntpos><cntaddr><addrtype>mailing</addrtype><address>1301 N.
